meanings.sent1: She wanted to professionalize her photography hobby by taking classes.
meanings.sent2: It is important to professionalize your behavior when attending a job interview.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to professionalize its hunting skills by wearing a tiny tie.
meanings.sent4: He aimed to professionalize his cooking abilities to Michelin-star level.
meanings.sent5: The workshop will help you professionalize your writing skills for business purposes.

meanings.definition: To conform to the standards of a profession.
meanings.sent1: The new employee needed to professionalize his communication style to fit in.
meanings.sent2: It's essential to professionalize your resume to increase your chances of getting hired.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to professionalize his act by juggling with more finesse.
meanings.sent4: She decided to professionalize her approach to time management like a seasoned executive.
meanings.sent5: The course will help you professionalize your teaching methods to meet educational standards.
